newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan share prices seen consolidating.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan share prices seen consolidating.

text.p: Taiwan share prices are expected to consolidate on Friday after recent volatile trade. Brokers said more people would stay on the sidelines on jitters over unsettled domestic politics and Sunday's anti-government protest.
On Thursday, the weighted index ended a roller-coaster session by closing 185.52 points or 2.27 percent lower at 7,996.10.
"Selling pressure should ease after Thursday's big selloff, but buying interest will be weak," said Wang Jieh, an analyst of Foremost Investment Services.
Taiwan activists said on Thursday that they would proceed with a protest on Sunday against President Lee Teng-hui, calling for the immediate replacement of his premier.
"The market's direction is very unclear. Investors are likely to adopt a wait-and-see attitude in the near future," Wang said.
Brokers saw the market's initial support at around 7,800 points, with resistance at 8,200 points.
